characters: SHOTS OF CLOTHES ALL OVER THE ROOM 126
PIECE OF MY HEART NOW, DARLIN'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Electric' doors zip open. ALEC NEWBERRY, a handsome possessor of The Right Stuff, his beautiful roommate LESLIE HUNTER, KEVIN DOLENZ, self-styled, chain- smoking, sardonic, and KIRBO KREAGER, short, hyper, dressed like a waiter -- dash worriedly into the busy emergency room. They are all twenty-two, or barely twenty-two. Only four months out of college, they are in their freshman year of life. Alec, Leslie, Kevin and Kirbo dash past a cubicle, where a totally naked, three-hundred-pound man paces in a daze. Past this, they find a black nurse talking with two COPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy Beamish and Billy Hicks? They were in a car accident?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: zip open again, introducing JULIANNA VAN PATTER (JULES), another freshman in life, but her sleek style gives her a certain sexual sophistication. She is accompanied by her dark, interesting DATE as she joins her friends and the Cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're dead, aren't they? Everyone ignores her as Alec hands his card to the Cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officers, I'm Alec Newberry with Congressman Langston's office. Leslie whispers to Jules, while Alec and the Cops talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think they're okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you aware there's a three- hundred-pound man walking around naked?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WENDY BEAMISH, a sweet-faced, insecure preppy, emerges from a first-aid room with a bandaged forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy. Oh, my God. Are you all right???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine. It's the car my father gave me for graduation that's totalled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find Billy. See if you can sober him up. Kevin always does what Alec tells him to. Meanwhile, Wendy pulls out her Visa card and speaks to the nurse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much do I owe you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He almost killed you. Destroyed your car, and you're paying...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules, please. As Leslie comforts her, Wendy is looking over Jules' Date who hovers in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that your date? The naked man wanders past them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's my date! As usual, Jules has managed to make Wendy laugh, Just as the Cops approach her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You pressing charges?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'I'm Mr. Hicks' legal counsel and he's not required to take any tests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a little late, Counselor. He's in the van giving blood right now. The Cops start toward the electric doors as Kirbo and Alec follow. Leslie helps Wendy with the bill. CAMERA FINDS Jules whispering dramatically to her Date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have to be with her all night. They don't know if she's going to make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shock. She could black out at any second... I'll call you... Jules joins Leslie and Wendy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too young... and don't you both start on your father complex theory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alec and Kirbo follow the Cops toward a mobile van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're dealing with a first offender here, and since Ms. Beamish doesn't want to press charges, whaddya say we just let this one slide, Officers? They reach the back of the mobile van, where we see BILLY HICKS, a handsome daredevil, playing his saxophone, wearing handcuffs, for two good-looking nurses and Kevin, who is trying to give him black coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you're under arrest. Alec looks to Kevin for information about Billy's condition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't strike a match near his blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, watch my sax...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . You girls believe in premarital sax? They laugh as Alec barks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy -- four months after graduation and you're still acting like every night's a fraternity party. Aren't you even concerned about Wendy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy? Jesus, how bad is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Severe. She might have finally exceeded the limit on her father's Visa. Billy smiles with relief as the Cops lead him toward their car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you both get serious. He's being arrested for drunk driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drunk maybe. But I don't know if you could call that driving. Wendy, Leslie and Jules come from the hospital, just in time to see Billy being put into the cop car. Wendy rushes to Billy and they embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, babe... sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be right behind you! They all move toward Alec's car except Kirbo, who sud- denly notices'someone. He becomes mesmerized as he falls away from the group and starts back for the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ST. ELMO'S FIRE - Rev. 10/1/84 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He enters and begins to pick up speed as he quickly catches up to a beautiful INTERN in a white lab coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale?... Dale Biberman? She hesitates, somewhat puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't remember me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do, but I'm trying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirby Kreager. You were a senior when I started Georgetown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirby... It's been four years. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I graduated!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always knew you would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm a lawyer. (as she looks at his waiter's duds) I mean I'm a waiter, studying to be a lawyer... and you became a doctor... Just like you said you would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost. I'm finishing my clinical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale Biberman. I can't believe it. Do you still like Woody Allen movies? There is a big COMMOTION at the other and of the hail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to go. Nice seeing you. She races down the hall, joining paramedics wheeling in a large black man on a gurney. His hysterical wife runs screaming behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ST. ELMO'S FIRE - Rev. 10/1/84 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale helps them maneuver the gurney down the hall, leavin a small black child, alone and frightened, in their wake. Dale comes running back and picks up the child. Kirbo watches, as the rest of the hospital moves in real time, but Dale, comforting the frightened child, moves in ROMANTIC SLOW MOTION. SONG BEGINS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madly in love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PANS the preppy nightlife and drinking spots. CAMERA FINDS a group of. postgrads moving into a build- ing. One of the postgrads drops his half of-a bureau and runs into the street toward Alec's old Oldsmobile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Billy, where's the fifty you owe me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alec drives while Leslie tends to Wendy between them. Billy, Kirbo and Kevin are in the back seat, with Jules on their lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alec, could you kinds burn a little rubber? Alec turns the corner as Billy continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for bailing me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A local hangout for those primarily in their twenties. Alec parks as his gang emerges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ST. ELMO'S FIRE - Rev. 10/1/84 7. s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When are you going to get a new car? One that truly expresses your lifestyle as the perfect couple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not everybody got recruited out of school into international banking, 'moneybags.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides... My mom and dad gave us this car. I think I was conceived in the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's still sticky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God. Wait 'til my father hears the car is totalled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna get you a new car, Wendy. Everyone screams in disbelief as they go into St. Elmo's. Alec, Leslie, Jules, Wendy, Kevin holds the door open, but no one thanks him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome. You're welcome. A young, burned-out UNDERGRAD (CLAYTON) follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not welcome, Clayton. How's school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baroque. Thank you very much. How's life after school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like getting slam-dunked against a brick wall, thank you very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: College is the last womb. Got a cigarette for a lowly undergrad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you tell me the meaning of life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ST. ELMO'S FIRE - Rev. 10/1/84 8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life? Life's like acne. It has to get worse before it gets better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young professionals, graduate students, and precocious undergrads populate the P.J. Clarke-like bar/restaurant. Kirbo quickly goes back to work waiting tables. Alec gets rid of a group of rowdy undergrads sitting at two tables pushed together. He admonishes WALLY, the burly owner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally! You let undergrad punks at our tables???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, Alec... they've only been there ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, we've been here for four years. Alec, Leslie, Jules, Wendy, Kevin and Billy (still with sax around his neck) take their usual chairs as Kirbo drops off a large pitcher of beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I need a real drink. Kirbo is long gone. Kevin pours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiters are like cops. Never around when you need one. Kevin and Alec begin bouncing quarters from the edge of a table into their beers -- obviously some ritual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will somebody get me a screwdriver?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a hammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what it means to have a suspended license for drunk driving on your record?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ST. ELMO'S FIRE - Rev. 10/1/84

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Al. It means I won't ever be able to be a cop in D.C... Hey, Wend, you're not angry are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never trust a woman who says she isn't angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better call your wife, Billy. Billy reluctantly leaves as Jules laces into Kevin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the one who's so angry these days. I thought writing for the Washington Post would make you happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Writing obituaries is not writing, Jules. All my characters die in the and. I'd like to write something about the meaning of life for a change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get your chance, Kevin. Alec suddenly spots TOMMY BANCROFT, an older version of Alec, across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Tommy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy Bancroft, Senator Hodges' key guy. Come on, I want you to meet him. They leave the table as Jules turns to Kevin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The meaning of life, Kevin, is fun, good times and a little H-U-M-O-R. Don't you enjoy anything anymore? Like girls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I enjoy being afraid of Russia. It's a harmless fear. Makes America feel better and Russia gets an inflated sense of national worth from our paranoia... Excuse me, I have to call in my latest epitaphs to the death squad. The presses are waiting. He gets up and leaves the table, passing Kirbo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see her at the hospital? Dale Biberman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, honey, I kinda had a car accident... What? Stop shouting. I know I don't have any insurance. Aren't you even gonna ask if I'm okay? -- Billy adjusts a framed photo on the wall of him, Alec, Jules, Wendy, Kevin, Leslie and Kirbo in their graduation caps and gowns. He notices a woman's reflection in the glass. He turns to see she is flirting with him from the bar. He smiles back. Kevin arrives and Billy sees a perfect way to get off the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's Kevin, he wants to say hello. He hands the phone to a more than reluctant Kevin and moves toward the YOUNG WOMAN at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Wally... a double screwdriver. He joins the Young Woman who is eyeing his sax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you believe in premarital sax?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leslie watches as Jules applies eyeshadow to Wendy's bruised eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you both give Billy a break? He lost his job today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The job Alec got for him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't give him any money, did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Г‚ВЂВў JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were going to take definite steps to change everything in your life that is not working. WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't leave much left. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I better break this to Alec gently before he finds out the wrong way and destroys his political career by murdering Billy in front of fifty witnesses. She leaves as Jules looks to Wendy. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy, this is all too destructive. WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life in the-fat lane. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not fat. WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My thighs are fat. And no diet works. The only way to lose weight on your thighs is amputation. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to amputate Billy the Kid. WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but I can't. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it. WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, either. 1 1 BAR 11

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy gets cozier with the Young Woman. YOUNG WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what line of work are you in? BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? I'm a very important drinker! So how 'bout we cut outta here? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ST. ELMO'S FIRE - Rev. 10/1/84 12. 11 CONTINUED: 11

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ГўВЂВў YOUNG WOMAN I came with my girl friend. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay, honey. This face seats five. Alec appears. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy, may I see you, please. Billy follows as Leslie alerts Kevin and Kirbo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alec and Billy enter. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up, Al? ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I see you over here, please. Billy joins him. Alec grabs him and shoves his head in the toilet. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me you blew another job? BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For some insane reason I thought you'd take it badly. Kevin and Kirbo rush in. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't drown him, he's a father. Alec releases Billy who comes up with his hair wet and gives Alec a major shove. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, you are a father and when are you gonna grow up? BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like this was real mature, Al? They all start to laugh. Alec softens. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ST. ELMO'S FIRE - Rev. 10/1/84 12A. 12 CONTINUED: (AL) 12 ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just got pissed off 'cause I had to pull so many strings to get you that job. (CONTINUED)
12 CONTINUED: 12 Г‚ВЂВў BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Working for Senator Pomerantz was not for me... Billy looks at himself in the mirror. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Billy. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all right. You couldn't help yourself. You're an asshole. Besides, the wet look is in. He shakes his head, showering them with toilet water. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do they put ice cubes in the urinals? KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It tastes better.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE MEN'S ROOM 13
dialogues.text: Leslie, Jules and Wendy wait anxiously, but the guys emerge, pals forever again. Together as a group, they join Tommy Bancroft and his pals at the jukebox singing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leslie works at a large drafting table in their sparsely furnished loft. She wears over-sized pajamas. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we could find the money it would be better to get the longer sofa. Alec enters in his underwear, brushing his teeth. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy Bancroft said I could start working on weekends for Hodges. No pay at first, but a way toward big dough. They wrap themselves around each other, kissing. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't Hodges a Republican? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ST. ELMO'S FIRE - Rev. 10/1/84 1 4. 14 CONTINUED: 14 0 C Г‚ВЂВў 15 ALEC 15

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a senator, and Republican senators' aides get paid a lot more than Democratic congressmen's assistants. LESLIE (KISSING HIM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to that Newberry political conviction I fell in love with? ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want the longer sofa? LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - I want you. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to buy you a red nightgown with satin and lace. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And rubber and leather... ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, leather... He opens her shirt and smothers her with love. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your breath is so sweet... Wait, let me get the babykiller. She starts for the bathroom. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Let's just do it. We're getting married soon. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so soon. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's take a chance... Russian roulette! LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And guess who has to carry the bullet around for nine months. There is a KNOCK at the front door. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ST. ELMO'S FIRE - Rev. 10/1/84 15. 14 CONTINUED: (2) 14 E R 15 LESLIE 15

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who could that be?  ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else could it be... Jules, of course, afraid to stay in her new apartment alone and she's spending the night again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules sits drinking vodka as Leslie listens. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this crummy welfare hospital called and remember I told you about my father's second wife. My 'stepmonster.' LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one who used to lock you in the closet all the time? JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gambled away all the money she got out of my father, is on her I deathbed and she put me down as next of kin. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what about your father? JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unreachable somewhere in South Africa with his new wife, who it turns out is only three years older than me. And if I don't reach him, guess who's going to end up paying for that old witch's funeral. Is there some insane irony to this or what? LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure your father will take care of everything. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, just like he takes care of everything else, including not showing up for my graduation. In the background, Alec has brought in their mattress and some sheets and a pillow. (CONTINUED)
16 CONTINUED: 16 JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Alec. You're still my Indiana Jones. Always coming to my rescue. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just know better than to try and break the umbilical cord between two old roommates. Good night, Jules. Leslie kisses Jules and goes into the bedroom with Alec. Jules takes another belt of vodka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dirty laundry and Woody Allen posters. Kevin sits in the middle of the mess looking at photographs longingly. He wears camouflage shirts, a black beret and shades -- drinks brandy and writhes in orgiastic ecstasy as he sings along with JANIS JOPLIN. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: PIECE OF MY HEART NOW, DARLIN'...
dialogues.text: Kirbo enters carrying his bike, and Kevin immediately hides the photographs in a straw basket and becomes his sophisticated self. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick, what's the meaning of life? KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale Biberman. Kevin looks puzzled as Kirbo hangs up his bike. KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl I fell in love with when we were freshmen. Remember, I met her at that big fountain on main campus? The one that says 'Knowledge, Art, Religion, Life'... she was sitting on the 'Life' side and she smiled at me. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You took her to one movie! That's not love, it's infatuation! Kirbo searches madly through records strewn on the floor. (CONTINUED)
17 CONTINUED: 17

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ГўВЂВў KI RBO Kevin, there are several quintessential moments in a man's life... losing his virginity... He yanks JANIS JOPLIN OFF abruptly. KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Getting married... becoming a father. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Killing his roommate for removing Janis Joplin for the soundtrack from Manhattan??? KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And having the right girl smile at you. She has the whitest teeth I've ever seen. "RHAPSODY IN BLUE" fills the room. Kevin begins gathering up his endless pieces of paper, notes, etc. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you think I'm going to live through another year of finding poorly written, unmailed love scratchings around this apartment. KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found her again. It's fate. It's true love. I have her hospital schedule! KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love is just an illusion created by lawyer-types like yourself to perpetuate another illusion called marriage to create the reality of divorce and the illusory need for divorce lawyers. Did you know there are more people in law school right now than there are lawyers on the planet? KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just bitter, 'cause you haven't had sex for a long time. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No wonder. The sexual revolution? Who won? (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ST. ELMO'S FIRE - Rev. 10/1/84 18. 17 CONTINUED: (2) 17 KEVIN (COHT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody... It used to be that sex was the only free thing in the world. No longer. Palimony, alimony. All financial. Love's an illusion. Finally having gathered up all his notes, Kevin moves toward the bedroom. KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the only illusion that counts. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Says who? KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone who's ever been in love. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love stinks. He moves into the bedroom, closing the door on Kirbo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A great fall day. Young people shop and party on the busy street. CAMERA FINDS Jules, Wendy and Leslie exit- ing a store with their purchases. Jules is on Wendy's case. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have bought the red dress. Red drives men mad. As two college guys hit on Jules she flips her red cape. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See... WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a mad man in my life already. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to put some kind of distance between you and Billy. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules is right. Kevin and Kirbo join them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ST. ELMO'S FIRE - Rev. 10/1/84 18A. 18 CONTINUED: 18 WEHDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's easy for both of you. Men are just a game for you Jules. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trivial pursuit. WEHDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And of course you and Alec are...

dialogues.speaker: LESLIE/JULES/WEHDY/KEVIN/KIRBO
dialogues.text: The perfect couple!!! They approach Jules' Jeep. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the pressure, guys... (TO WENDY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .. Shouldn't we be finding you an apartment? 19 OMITTED 19 & C 20 20

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ГўВЂВў The group picks up Alec and Billy who have just co a small office building. Billy has made a great effort to look establishment. Alec, as always, looks like a Ralph Lauren ad. They cram into the crowded Jeep. WEND Y

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you do? BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm an official pollster, thanks to Alec. Everyone applauds. ALEC (KISSING LESLIE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to promise our first born. 'Keep your nose clean and you could move up fast, Billy. Billy is quickly pulling off his tie, unbuttoning his shirt and messing up his hair. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a god, Alec. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout bloody Marys on me at St. Elmo's? Everyone cheers except Alec. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta get back to work. KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when do you work on Saturdays? LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since he started volunteer moonlighting for Senator Hodges. KI RBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is the three-year president of Georgetown's Young Democrats doing working for a Republican? ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving up, Kirbo. As most of the others boo and hiss playfully, CAMERA FINDS Billy talking to Wendy. Reaching in his pocket, he gives her a toy car. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mb tEti4yA) Rev. 10/11/84 20. 21 R CONTINUED: 21 BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you I'd get you a new car. I'm goin' ultimate on this gig, Wend. Gonna pay you back for everything... Let's celebrate tonight. WENDY MI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Felicia and the baby? BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, come on, it's Saturday night. Let's party out. Let's go ultimate. Could he mean sex? Love? What she's been waiting for? WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Why can't I say no to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jeep parked, Jules lets Kevin in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules and Kevin can be heard CLIMBING the STAIRS outside.

dialogues.speaker: JULES, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: You haven't been here since you helped me move in...

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh, did you move in, too? I only. remember 800 pair of shoes. She opens the elaborate locks and they enter. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think? KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very subtle and very pink. Must have cost some subtle bucks. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you think God invented credit for fabulous people like me? Fix us a drink. She disappears into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: JULES, (0.5.)
dialogues.text: I knew you'd like it. You have such sensitivity... Fix me a vodka rocks... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ST. ELMO'S FIRE - Rev. 10/1/84 24. 29 CONTINUED: 29

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: V There's no one home. Sadly she walks back to her apart- ment. It's getting darker outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirbo, wearing a jacket, anxiously waits behind a tree, watching a car pull into the parking lot. Dale Biberman emerges. Kirbo keeps out of sight, and frantically dashes toward a side entrance to the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirbo dashes down the hall. Approaching a corner,-he immediately achieves nonchalance as he "accidentally" runs into Dale at the entrance. KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, Dale? How nice to see you again. DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirby, what brings you back here? Nothing serious, I hope. KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no... just tying up some legal loose ends for my friends... DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me... I'm late... KI RBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, funny running into you again. I noticed there's going to be a Woody Allen festival and I thought maybe we... DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get to the movies much anymore... I've got to go. She is moving away.

dialogues.speaker: K I RBO
dialogues.text: Well, lunch. How about lunch? DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. That would be nice sometime. She is moving quicker. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ST. ELMO'S FIRE - Rev. 10/1/84 25. 31 CONTINUED: 31 Г‚ВЂВў KIRRO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wednesday? How about Wednesday? Dale is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leslie is trying to coordinate dinner'while Kevin is looking at a rendering of a complex housing unit. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A whole community within itself. Right near Lockheed. Open some wine. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like it could be put together with Leggo blocks. You design this?

dialogues.speaker: .LESLIE
dialogues.text: I did all the mechanicals for one of our senior architects and I think he's going to promote me to the design staff. Kevin is fighting with a ridiculous wine opener. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you could design a corkscrew that actually works. Everything in this apartment comes from Scandinavia. They don't even have wine in Scandinavia. Naturally Leslie opens it in a flash. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think my attachment to Alec is unnatural? LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I think mine is. We've only just started to live together and he's already pushing for 'the wedding.' KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, since you fell in love with a Democrat and now he's a Republican, I think all bets are off. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ST. ELMO'S FIRE - Rev. 10/1/84 26. 32 CONTINUED: 32

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ГўВЂВў Leslie burns herself and shouts. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do some women do this every night of their lives and not go insane? KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are insane. Wives, husbands, children, love, marriage, relationship. It's all insane. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm afraid of. Did I tell you that my perfect sister and her perfect husband are getting a perfect divorce-? KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have the perfect cure. Stay away from love. He finds the butter and puts some on her hand. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must have been in love, once. You like hot peppers? KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't Alec hate them? LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Insurrection... Now, come on, Kevin, you must have been in love with somebody, sometime... KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once, in junior high. I played guitar in a group and fellin love with our singer who did 'We've Only Just Begun' as sweet as Karen Carpenter. I got high on cheap champagne and pledged my love. Next day she ran off with the bass player named Rocky and I traded my guitar in for a battered Underwood typewriter. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On which you will type your way to being one of the most important writers in America. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ST. ELMO'S FIRE - Rev. 10/11/84 27. 32 CONTINUED: (2) 32 KEVIN Г‚ВЂВў

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On which I continue to turn out obituaries and very little else... Taking out shreds of papers and napkins. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't seem to organize any of my thoughts into anything of any substance. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you need to stop thinking so much and fall in love again. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love stinks. The door opens and Alec arrives home. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, guys. He kisses Leslie. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rough day with the right wing, dear? Alec hands Leslie a red box. She opens it excitedly and finds a black lace nightgown. She screams as Alec heads for the kitchen. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try it on... Leslie makes naughty eyes at Kevin and disappears into the bedroom. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leslie has to marry me, soon. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, you pregnant? Kidding. What's your 'marriage' hurry? ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you have a serious relationship, Kev, you'll find out the problem with living together: it's too easy. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe for you and Leslie. You have the perfect relationship. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ST. ELMO'S FIRE - Rev. 10/11/84 28. s 32 CONTINUED: (3) 32 I ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, it's too easy to get out of. You either build to something bigger -- like marriage -- or one day you could make a mistake and the person you were living with is gone. Alec takes a bite of dinner and cringes. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to kill myself. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're only peppers, Alec. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe what I just did. I innocently go to buy the nightgown and this amazing blonde salesgirl starts coming on to me... we wind up doing it standing up in front of a three-way mirror in the dressing room. He lies down on the floor. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Leslie would just marry me, I know I wouldn't do stuff like that -- it would be a legal violation. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As opposed to tonight's standing violation. You think marriage is going to make you faithful? ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The idea of two people spending their lives together was invented by people who were lucky to make it to thirty without being eaten by dinosaurs. Marriage is obsolete. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinosaurs are obsolete. Marriage is still around. Leslie screams from the bedroom. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ST. ELMO'S FIRE - Rev. 10/11/84 28A. 32 CONTINUED: (4) 32

dialogues.speaker: LESLIE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is obscene. I love it. Alec dashes into the bedroom. As he opens and then closes the door, Kevin sees a flash of Leslie looking absolutely ravishing in the nightgown. As they SCREAM and PLAY, Kevin, feeling very alone, stirs the burning dinner. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few hookers work the corner. FOCUS ON a BLACK HOOKER talking to passing car. BLACK HOOKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want a date...? Hi... you want a date... Kevin passes quietly and she ignores him. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you ever ask me if I want a date? BLACK HOOKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause I thought you were gay. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you think I'm gay? BLACK HOOKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause I never see you with a girl. And you always look real strange. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, just for your information. I happen to be in love with someone but they don't know it. I guess you wouldn't understand loving someone from afar. He takes a swig from a bottle in a paper bag. BLACK HOOKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delaware's about as far as I've ever gone. Is this person a he or a she? She takes the bottle and takes a swig. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a secret. But I guess you wouldn't understand about that, either. BLACK HOOKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh honey, lots of people come to me for love and it's a secret. He takes his bottle back and goes home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy is interviewing a good-looking WOMAN with five children crawling all over her. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ST. ELMO'S FIRE - Rev. 10/1/84 30 34 CONTINUED: 34 WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See our real purpose, Miss Chambers, or do you prefer Ms... is to get you off welfare and train you in a skilled profession. Now, do you have any interest in the janitorial field? WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jus' give me my check. WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are educational... WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jus' give me my check. Wendy hands her the check. WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get some hot clothes, get yourself a man... you won't be worryin' about all this shit. She leaves as Billy arrives in time to check her out. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welfare recipients are getting better-looking these days. WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever feel like you're not accomplishing anything? Billy sits on her desk. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm in touch with the feeling. Let's go get a drink. WEND Y

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy, why aren't you at work? Billy gives her a look she knows all too well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy and Billy sit at the bar as Kirbo pours. KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy, the only extra money I have is my savings for the most important date of my life. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ST. ELMO'S FIRE - Rev. 10/1/84 31. 35 CONTINUED: 35 WENDY E

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you in love? KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ripped between rapture and s torture. s WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm all tapped out from the accident but I could probably get some from my father... BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more money from you, Wend. But maybe you could help me find another job. WEND-Y

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any interest in the janitorial field? They both smile. WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should be playing your music. Billy... BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a family man and the rent is due. Alec, followed by Kevin, storms into the bar and attacks Billy. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dumb shit. You have to start making passes at the women you're supposed to be polling? BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, they were the ones who suggested another type of polin'... He smiles as Alec grabs him. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're twenty-three years old. You got a wife and kid. BILLY A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're a great American.- Are you new at this? Or just an asshole? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ST. ELMO'S FIRE - Rev. 10/1/84 32. 35 CONTINUED: (2) 35 Г‚ВЂВў ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not the fraternity star anymore. No more Billy the Kid. Billy starts to leave. Alec follows. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't bargain for you turning out this way. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I didn't bargain for you turning into a pompous politico. Suckin' up to Hodges. That's it, Al, isn't it?... You've become a Republican!!! ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you've become a drunk. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no, not just 'a' drunk, Big Al. One of the great drunks! Born, bred and diseased in the s U.S.A. (TO WENDY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on... (TO KEVIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You with us, Kev...? Kevin hesitates. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I forgot, Kev. You don't do anything Alec doesn't tell you to do. Well, that's-okay, 'cause just remember one thing. You can pick your friends and you can pick your nose, but you can't pick your friend's nose. Billy leaves. Wendy looks at Alec and starts to laugh. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay right here, Wendy. She can't and runs after Billy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are both asleep as the PHONE RINGS. Alec pulls himself together and speaks alertly. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alec Newberry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ST. ELMO'S FIRE - Rev. 10/1/84 33. 37 INT. VAN BUREN HOTEL - BATHROOM - NIGHT 37 s ГўВЂВў Jules, wearing a sexy dress, whispers into the pho JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alec, it's Jules. I'm at the Van Buren... X INTERCUT their phone conversation.

dialogues.speaker: ALEC, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: What time is it? JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please... I'm with these Arabs... and they've been forcing me to do coke all night... And I only understand a little Arabic, but I'm sure I heard the words for 'gang bang' and 'white slavery'... Please get me out of here... Suite 2708.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leslie watches anxiously as Alec throws on his clothes. A LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so wonderful taking care of all of us. I love you. I really, truly love you. He kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alec gives his car to a valet and rushes into the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator opens and Alec quickly finds the room and knocks loudly.

dialogues.speaker: ARAB VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Yes. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open up. After a beat, the door is opened by a sedate Arab businessman. Alec pushes past him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ST. ELMO'S FIRE - Rev.. 10/1/84 34.

dialogues.speaker: IXT. SUITE
dialogues.text: Four additional sedate Arab businessmen sit calmly watching MTV. Jules is pacing nervously by the bar, smoking. She fakes surprise at Alec's entrance. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alec, what are you doing here? He quickly grabs her and they leave the suite. The Arabs hardly notice. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, nobody make a move. 42 INT. VAX BUREN LOBBY - RIGHT 42 s Jules and Alec walk from the elevators. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a real pal. My Indiana Jones. I won't forget how you came to my rescue again. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hardly impressed me as the gang bang type, Jules. Now much coke have you done? JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shovels full. They've got barrels. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just paranoid from the coke. You know sometimes I think you just make up these dramas to test me or something. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's very interesting, let's stay up all night like the old days and discuss it. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to be at work in a few hours. (INDICATING HER FURS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And where are you getting all this money from? JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'I'm a financial genius, haven't you heard? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ST. ELMO'S FIRE - Rev. 10/1/84 35. 42 CONTINUED: 42

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes toward the public phone. LJ ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you calling? JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A systems analyst I met... very hot Jewish guy. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you, the new Middle East Ambassador? It's two-thirty. Come on, I'll take you home. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And waste all this good coke! As Jules connects with her number, Alec starts to head out of the hotel in disgust. A beautiful older woman is getting her key from the desk and crosses in front of him toward the elevators. She and Alec check each other out. He smiles. She smiles. As her elevator, arrives, she changes her mind and, giving Alec an inviting smile, steps into the dimly-lit bar. Alec is torn between morality and temptation. Temptation wins as he follows the sexy lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirbo, dressed in his best, enters the elegant, but empty dining room. Searching around quickly, he begins to try out various tables. He exchanges floral arrangements at one as the austere MAITRE D' approaches as Kirbo peruses a menu. MAITRE D'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sir. We do not open until eleven. KI RBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all right. I'll wait. MAITRE D'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a reservation? KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Kreager. One o'clock. I want this table. MAITRE D'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that time, I will find a lovely table for you and your guest. But this is a table for four. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ST. ELMO'S FIRE - Rev. 10/1/84 36. 43 CONTINUED: 43 KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll pay double. MAITRE D'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. KI RBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want this table... and I'm waiting right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules, wearing glasses, is at work speaking on the phone in front of a bank of computers.. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could order a nice Napa Valley Chardonney, unless you want to impress her with an import.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBO IN THE RESTAURANT 45
dialogues.text: With a phone at his table, looking at the menu. KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Money's no object.

dialogues.speaker: JULES, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Montrechart or Mersalt then and don't forget to smell the cork. KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay and how do you say escargot?

dialogues.speaker: JULES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Escargot. I'd stay away from them if I were you... heavy garlic.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BANK 46
dialogues.text: A WOMAN moves through the desks with a box of envelopes. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's payday, thank God! WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules, you're advanced on your salary two months. I have no check for you.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Jules, I owe you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ST. ELMO'S FIRE - Rev. 10/1/84 37. 46 CONTINUED: 46 Г‚ВЂВў JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good. 'Cause I owe everyone else. She hangs up and follows the Woman. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to pay for my stepmonster's funeral. Then I'll catch up. WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid you'll have to see Forrester Davidson. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The president of the bank?

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO RESTAURANT 47
dialogues.text: The Maitre D' grandly takes the phone from Kirbo's table. KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you please clean up these crumbs, waiter? MAITRE D'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not the waiter. I am the captain. KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, aye, sir. Dale Biberman rushes into the restaurant in all her splendor. Kirbo is extremely excited. DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I'm late. Have you been waiting long? KIRB0

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just got here. Kirbo beats out the Maitre D' and pulls out Dale's chair; DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The food is great here.

dialogues.speaker: K I RBO
dialogues.text: I'll be having the alfalfa sprouts and a plate of mashed yeast. (CONTIRUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ST. ELMO'S FIRE - Rev. 10/1/84 38. 47 COHTIHUED: 47 Г‚ВЂВў DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a vegetarian? KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ho... that's from Annie Hall, the movie we saw together... don't you remember? DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's funny... I thought we went to see a Mel Brooks movie. KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ho... it was Annie Hall. DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure? 'Cause I don't like _ Woody Allen movies very much. KI RBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, me, too. I hate Woody Allen movies. The Maitre D' comes over to the table. MAITRE D'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you be ordering any wine? KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course... We'll have the... DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't... I'm on call. Kirbo is shot down as the Maitre D' hands Dale a menu. KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... how's your, uh... are you seeing anyone? DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

'Fluff and Fold,' buddy. Soon as I get some dough, I'm goin' 'Fluff and Fold.'

dialogues.text: They move through the busy street together passing some double Dutch champions. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll go fluff and fold, someday.  Whereas I will still be writing obits. I can't even come up with a decent piece for the paper to show my editor. KIRBO

dialogues.text: I can't help you with your writer's block -- until I see that look in Dale Biberman's eyes. The look that says she knows I'm the one for her. KEVIN

I become a legend -- do a black mink ad, but get caught in a sex scandal. Retire in massive disgrace -- but write a huge bestseller and become the star of my own talk show. WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: on a coffee table) .. I steal People magazine from my dentist's office. She then goes into the tiny kitchen and picks up a large garbage bag. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: And here's the worst of all... When I first decided to be a doctor, I thought it was because I wanted to serve people. But now, well, I'm beginning to get this funny feeling that what medicine's really all about is money... You want some coffee? MIRBO

dialogues.text: You know I've been thinkin', Troy 6 9 I'd like to get some kind of job maybe on campus... you know work with the students or the fraternity. Maybe coaching or something. TROY

dialogues.text: Felic... FELICIA

dialogues.text: I work out of my house. You must be available twenty-four hours a day. Complete discretion and loyalty. Five hundred dollars a week. We now see he is talking to Kirbo. KIRBO

dialogues.text: Yeah, and like my pop says, 'The way to woman's heart is,to saw her in half.'

dialogues.text: The best advice I can give you undergrads is to fail. Failure is a virtue in today's society. Human error is a badge of honor. If you're the alcoholic child of a celebrity, you can blame them and earn a year on the best-seller list. If you're a celebrity, your mistake will earn you a People magazine cover. It's post- Watergate morality. Take responsibility for your mistakes and make a quick buck while you're at it. ALEC

dialogues.text: Hey, Howie... how 'bout we make it a double wedding? They pass Kirbo who dashes out of the kitchen franti- cally. He finds Wendy. KI RBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy, please, this is the most important thing in my life... WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's brand new. KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: 12 INT. KITCHEN
dialogues.text: ГўВЂВў Alec and Leslie talk as the servants pretend not t eavesdrop. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just want a yearly Christmas card with the Newberrys in front of the fireplace.. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just afraid to commit. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to slow down your career to help raise them. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, will you just for once not make the reason you won't marry me your fucking career! LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right then, what will we do about your extra-curricular love life? ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
