dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ST. ELMO'S FIRE - Rev. 10/1/84 76. 112 COHTIHUED: 112 ALEC (COHT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did Kevin tell you?  LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  ALEC A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? He dashes back into the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where people are dancing and cavorting. Quickly finding Kevin, Alec punches him with all his might. Kevin goes flying. People shout as Kevin lands against the stereo, taking several thousands of dollars' worth of porcelain, jade and flowers with him. Leslie runs to Kevin's aid. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you tell her?... Little buddy... little traitor. Huh, what'd you tell her? LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He told me nothing. It was just a hunch... until now. Alec filled with guilt and remorse becomes angrier. Alec realizes that everybody in the house is watching him. He  must save face. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leslie, I want you out of the apartment tonight.  Alec marches out the door. The place is a wreck. (CONTINUED)
113 CONTINUED: 113 BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. everything's cool. It's not a party 'til something gets broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy's car still running. Kirbo buzzes Dale's bell and shouts up to her second-story window: KI RBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better get off the phone and open this door! Suddenly the window above him opens and Dale's roommate Judith appears angrily. JUDITH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you the maniac trying to cut in on my line? KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is Dale? JUDITH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She went skiing. KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What???... Where??? JUDITH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should I tell you? KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I'm not responsible for what I'll do to you if you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin and Leslie walk together silently. Kevin sees they are approaching his neighborhood Black Hooker. He proudly takes Leslie's arm. He'll show her who's gay. BLACK HOOKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .You think you ain't gonna pay? You'll pay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Usual mess. Kevin enters and quickly starts to pick up. (CONTINUED)
116 CONTINUED: 116 LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't been here for a long time. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's still the same. Small and ugly... but then again it's small and ugly. Are you sure we shouldn't find you some nice lady-like hotel? LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'll be fine here for tonight 0 as long as I'm not putting you or Kirbo to any trouble... (NOTICES SOMETHING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . What are you doing.with a coffin? We now see that a long coffee table which has always been covered with junk is indeed a black coffin. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not how you're supposed to ask. You're supposed to be a young lady who is very impressed with. my mind. Having come from a deep Hungarian film and getting cozy over a brandy, she says... 'Is that... a coffin...?' And, then I say, 'Yes, it's my coffin' . 'Your coffin,' she would gasp, her interest in me growing by leaps and bounds. Then'I would sit back stroking her arm and say 'Yes, I figured we're going to spend a long time in the ground together so I've made friends with it... I've gotten drunk on it... rolled joints on it . Even made love on it many times!' It's a prop for affect. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it work? KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would I know? LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you better not let Jules see it. She'll steal it for her stepmother. Are these relatives of yours? (CONTINUED)
116 CONTINUED: (2) 116

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds up a beautiful photograph of a very beautiful E

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: distinguished family. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's more effect. He opens a straw box, obviously filled with his most personal possessions and extricates a photograph of a very ordinary family. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember my family. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I've wandered into a real woman trap here, haven't I? KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except you're the first woman I've ever been able to get up here. And I've blown all my props already... So how about some brandy? Kevin searches for clean glasses in the debris that passes for a kitchen, Leslie finds photos and political cartoons in his straw box. Eventually, she finds a photo of herself, and then another -- followed by dozens more. Kevin has an entire homage to her in his secret stash. He comes back with the brandy to find her looking at the photos. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I part of your props? KEVIN (PAINFULLY; SWEETLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... you're the real thing. He quickly starts pouring the brandy as Leslie looks at Kevin, almost for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is starting to snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirbo drives frantically. As snowflakes begin to hit the windshield, he grabs for the windshield wiper. Not knowing how it works, he forces it the wrong way. The handle comes off in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ST. ELMO'S FIRE - Rev. 10/11/84 83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC PLAYS. Much brandy has been had. R LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alec was the first. There were other guys, in high school, boys -- but he was the first love of my life. I always wondered if Alec and I hadn't ended up in the same dorm -- well, I guess I would have just found someone else. And so would he. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alec had the luck of geography. Whatever we say about Alec we'll regret tomorrow. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think about our relationship. as an outsider? KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooo -- dangerous question. (BIG SLUG)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I think I just hang around with you and Alec 'cause. well, since he introduced me to you... LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I think the reason I'm not interested in other women... is 'cause I... LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tears of joy) Kevin. All this time right in front of us. How could I have been so blind? KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leslie, we won't even remember this tomorrow. (CONTINUED)
125 CONTINUED: (2) 125 LESLIE S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is tomorrow. There is a mad moment of hesitation and then Kevin and Leslie smash into each other's arms. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you... I've always loved you. They kiss madly, passionately. They fall to the floor in a frenzy. Leslie pulls Kevin's hair. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaaaah. Ouch... (as she stops) No. I love it. I love it!!! Leslie grabs onto the large throw rug as they roll around the floor. Somehow as they roll and turn, the rug gets wrapped around them. Leslie tears at his shirt, as he yanks her sweater off. Kevin fights madly with the back of Leslie's bra. He is going berserk trying to find the clasp. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... it's in front. With a flick of her hand she undoes her bra and opens up the wonders of paradise to her old buddy. They kiss madly again as they roll in the rug.

dialogues.speaker: SHOTS OF CLOTHES ALL OVER THE ROOM 126
dialogues.text: Leslie and Kevin fuck on the floor, on the coffin, in the shower. All over the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The worst turnpike in the world. Kirbo swerves on the slushy lanes. Fortunately he is the only car on the road.

dialogues.speaker: KIRBO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Dear Mr. Iacoccoa... Recently, in a life and death situation, I had the bad luck to use one of your so-called luxury cars... Finally, he sees a large sign reading: "SEVEN SPRINGS."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ST. ELMO'S FIRE - Rev. 10/11/84 80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 0 Jules' Jeep (with vinyl doors for the winter) cruises down the middle of the cold, quiet street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules, in a fur coat, is driving Billy home. They both are moving kind of slow, having had too much of everything. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one is yours? I always forget. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do I. You wanna go someplace? He points to a house. Jules stops the Jeep. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I. I've had a shit day. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had a shit year. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you want to go? BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bars are all closed. How 'bout your place? JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to my place. Good. She STARTS up the JEEP. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules, you've really grown up into a fine-looking woman. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't feel very fine-looking. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been meaning to ask you something all night. What do you have on under that skirt? JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should know. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ST. ELMO'S FIRE - Rev. 10/11/84 81. 120 CONTINUED: 120 Г‚ВЂВў BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on -- Gimme some of those beautiful lips. Jules needs some attention. The hot couple kiss. He immediately goes for the gold. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy... enough! BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who says? JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I bet you really won't have so much to say with me in your mouth. He kisses her wildly as she pushes him away aggressively. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious, Billy. No!!! He grabs the keys from the ignition as the CAR DIES. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy! Holding her off with one hand, he shoves the keys into his underwear and then sits back grinning. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come and get 'em. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shit!!! She attacks him, biting his hands, his neck and his chest. Billy shrieks with laughter and pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tumbles out of the Jeep, onto the street, laughing and shouting. Jules tumbles right after him, belting, pinch- ing, biting. As she goes to kick him, Billy slides between her legs and looks up under her skirt. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ultimate... (ECHO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ultimate!! (CONTINUED) J

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ST. ELMO'S FIRE - Rev. 10/11/84 82. s 121 COHTIHUED: 121

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ГўВЂВў She sits down an his chest, undoes his pants and g keys. Felt up with all, she heads back to the Jeep. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really needed you tonight. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nell, just get back in the Jeep and assume the missionary position. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You break my heart. You break everybody's heart. She drives off in the Jeep. Billy fumbles with his pants and then turns toward his house. Felicia, holding their baby, stands watching from the porch. Obviously having seen most of this, she silently goes back into the house, locks the door and turns out the light. Alone, drunk and bewildered, Billy starts moving away from the house real- izing he has no place to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirbo is still driving frantically, but, without the windshield wipers, snow is building rapidly on the wind- shield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirbo, with one hand on the wheel, hangs out of the car using his left hand to wipe off the snow. It's cold. KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit... Goddammitt...

dialogues.speaker: IHT. CAR
dialogues.text: He searches the dashboard frantically. KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heater. Where's the defroster??? He rams and jams every button and knob in sight as he weaves dangerously on the freeway. Eventually one of the levers comes off in his hand. KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Mr. Iacoccoa... I recently had the misfortune of using one of your, so-called, new luxury cars in an emergency situation. So much for American enterprise!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ГўВЂВў Kirbo tries to stop the car in front of a cabin, b it slides further than he had planned and almost hits it. Getting out and trudging through the snow, in his party clothes. he bangs on the door.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Who is it? KI RBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Dale Biberman in there?

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Who wants to know? KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirby Kreager! And who the hell are you? The door swings open and there stands GUY, a handsome thirty-year-old wrapped in a blanket. Dale comes from the bedroom, fastening a man's robe and staring at Kirbo in disbelief. DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirby? What are you doing here? His entire world has collapsed. He can't swear, shout or cry -- he can only dash toward the car frantically. Falling in the snow once or twice, he eventually jumps into the car and tries to peel out, but it just spins in the snow. Meanwhile Guy has put on heavy boots and comes running out to the car where Kirbo stands on the gas to no avail. DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirby, stop. Come inside. He ignores her maniacally as he keeps desperately trying to get out of there. GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got no skid chains or snow tires. You've got no traction. Kirbo ignores them. DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirby, please! GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You-'re not gonna get out of here tonight. You better come back inside. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll stay in the car. GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling at Dale) He wants to stay in the car. DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll freeze!!! She begins pulling on her boots as Guy tries to reason with Kirby. GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People have died out here. KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone. I'm not your responsibility! Dale has joined them. DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By driving up here, you've made us responsible for you. Now come inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirbo sits in front of the fire wrapped in a blanket. Guy goes back into the bedroom as Dale finishes making a bed for him on the sofa. DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your clothes should be dry in a few hours. KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a doctor, isn't he? DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here are some pajamas. KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You expect me to wear his pajamas? DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll talk in the morning. She joins Guy, in the bedroom and closes the door. Kirbo is left with the pajamas and his desperate anguish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is destroyed as Leslie and Kevin lie on the floor blissfully in each other's arms. They hear the front DOOR OPEN. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirbo?

dialogues.speaker: ALEC, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: No, it's Alec. Kevin and Leslie look at each other frantically. KEVIN (WHISPERING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gave him a key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alec, miserable, hungover, having walked all night in the cold, shuffles around the living room. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm only gonna ask you this once. Did you tell Leslie about my screwing around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin looks to Leslie as they wonder how to handle this. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alec has found a beer. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe you. I want you to know that I believe you and, Kev, I'm sorry I hit you. Shit, how'd she find out? How long has she known? I've been thinking all night about school... How sex was always a barometer,'especially, at the fraternity. The more women you got, the more of a man you were... or thought you were... I thought I was. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
133 CONTINUED: 133 9 ALEC (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, my whole life at school revolved around sex... even after I fell in love with Leslie. I always had to be doing better than the next guy... I had my rep. Big Al... It all started as a game... Kevin gingerly comes from the bedroom in a robe. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah... I kind of have company. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus... I'm sorry... I never thought. Who is it? KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alec... ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That fat chick from the party? You and the fat chick... KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alec, I'll call you later. Alec capitulates and leaves the apartment. Kevin relaxes just as Alec pops back in. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell me if it's the fat chick... The bedroom door opens and Leslie appears wrapped in a sheet. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No. No... wait a minute... I don't believe it. This could not be real. There is no way this is happening. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It happened, Alec. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not Kevin. Little fuckin' Kevin. My little buddy. No way, Jose. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't do it alone, Alec. (CONTINUED)
133 CONTINUED: (2) 133

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alec moves toward Kevin with murder as his intent. Kevin Г‚ВЂВў

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: takes a stand. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that if we fight, you're going to win. But I'm warning you, I will use every bone in my body, every lamp in this room to make sure I inflict as much damage as possible on you before you bring me down. Kevin prepares for the fight. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're both pathetic. I don't want to see either one of you again, ever. You understand me? You see me on the street, you see me at St. Elmo's, just pretend you don't know me. On his exit, Alec takes a lamp and throws it against a Woody Allen photograph on the wall. Kevin and Leslie look at each other, uncertain of what they have done. Г‚ВЂВў

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A taxi delivers Mr. Ho to his front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Ho enters to find a big mess from the party and Wendy and Howie asleep in the living room.

dialogues.speaker: KIM SUNG HO
dialogues.text: Where's'Kirby Kreager? WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He took my new car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ГўВЂВў Guy is heating up the block of Wendy's car with a of hair dryers on long extension cords. He shouts toward the open door of the cabin. (CONTINUED)
137 CONTINUED: 137 0 GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's thawing... and the roads look pretty clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale is doing dishes -- Kirbo hasn't touched his break- fast. He looks suicidal and possessed. DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I had no idea it had gone this far. KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gave up school... and my job at St. Elmo's... and you never even knew about it. It's kind of funny, isn't it? Dale sits down next to him. DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reason I didn't know... is because all of this happened R

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: between you and you. I could never participate because I never knew what was expected of me. Love isn't like this, Kirby. It's mutual and reciprocal. Guy yells to them from outside.

dialogues.speaker: GUY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Okay, she's starting... You better get out of here before it starts snowing again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy sits in Wendy's CAR making everythng HUM. Dale escorts Kirbo. DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drive carefully. Guy gets out of the car. GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute... I've got to get a picture of you old college chums... (CONTINUED)
139 CONTINUED: 139

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 0 He goes into the cabin. Dale sees Kixbo's pain. DALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really know you well... but you seem like a fine person .. and I want you to know that I'm flattered by all of this and deep down, I'm sure for a long time, I'll wonder if maybe this somehow isn't my loss. She kisses him gently on the cheek. He is about to sink into more pain when suddenly he grabs Dale and kisses her with all the passion he has for her. When he releases her she is dazed. Something has definitely happened. GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smile. They turn to face Guy and his Polaroid camera. After he takes their photo, he hands it to Kirbo who hands it to Dale'and quickly gets into the car. GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you going to wait for it to develop? Kirbo drives off quickly. REARVIEW MIRROR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale gets smaller and smaller.

dialogues.speaker: IK DALE'S HAND
dialogues.text: The Polaroid picture becomes clear of Kirbo and Dale. MIRROR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is smaller and smaller. KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A kind of win fills his senses.

dialogues.speaker: 40 INT. WENDY'S CAR
dialogues.text: The mirror, the Polaroid, the snow, the sun, they fuse together in a brilliant, incandescent white light that FILLS the SCREEN. In this glaw we rapidly -- DISSOLVE TO: Г‚ВЂВў
143 CONTINUED: 143

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ГўВЂВў MR. BEAMISH Love comes later. Marriage, family, the family business -- children carrying on the parents' traditions... that's what... WEHDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, I have my own work, and I want to get my own apartment.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BEAMISH
dialogues.text: All right, keep your job 'til you get pregnant. Howie is a fine boy. You don't need your own apartment. WEHDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't love Howie, Dad. I love Billy!

dialogues.speaker: MR. BEAMISH
dialogues.text: Billy on the roof? Let me tell you something, he's a drunk and a lowlife. How could you love such a person? WEHDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's talented and confused and he's not a lowlife. And I love him because he's alive! He's the most alive person I've ever known.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BEAMISH
dialogues.text: When he looks at you, all he sees is U money. He doesn't give a damn about you... Wendy has started to cry.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BEAMISH
dialogues.text: I'm warning you, young lady. You marry him -- no 'Card-A-Terias' ! Wendy is overcome with grief. WEHDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate you, Dad. I really hate you now. She rushes from the counter grabbing her coat. 40

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy rushes into the street crying. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (LATE NOVEMBER) Г‚ВЂВў

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOTS of lunchtime in D.C.: Clerks, pages, government employees of all description leave work and venture forth for the lunch ritual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy leaves the Welfare office and hurries down the street. She comes to the window of a modest coffee shop and looks inside. Her father is waiting for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy and her father sit at a counter FACING the CAMERA. They finish ordering as the waitress leaves them.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BEAMISH
dialogues.text: Some place this is. Your car fixed? WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a personal letter from Lee lacocco... they fixed everything for nothing.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BEAMISH
dialogues.text: Good... so you like the car? WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a great car, Dad, but I can't keep it. I don't feel right about driving a car like that and working with people who can't afford to eat. She finds the keys and hands them to him.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BEAMISH
dialogues.text: Keep the car... you and Howie are going to need it. WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm giving Howie back, too.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BEAMISH
dialogues.text: Wendy, listen to me. You think I wanted to marry your mother? I was pressured into it. She was pressured into it. WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't love Howie. (CONTINUED)
144 CONTINUED: 144

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eventually, Mr. Beamish comes running after her.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BEAMISH
dialogues.text: Wendy... Wendy keeps running. A BAG LADY from the soup kitchen, crosses her path. BAG LADY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Wendy. A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy ignores her as she keeps running. Mr. Beamish suddenly gets a cramp in his leg.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BEAMISH
dialogues.text: Wendy... Wait. Oh, my God, my leg! Wendy continues running and crying as YOUNG STREET TOUGHS run past her. STREET TOUGH #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Wendy... we got the old pervert covered. Wendy keeps running, but then looks back. The Street Toughs are giving her father a hard time as he puffs, wheezes and deals with the pain in his chest and his leg. Wendy can't stand it. She shouts at them. WEND Y

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my father. You leave him alone... that's my father! She runs over to them and shoos the Toughs away. Still crying, she guides her father toward a stoop. WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down, Daddy... sit down. They sit down, both still very emotional. After a moment, Mr. Beamish takes a torn greeting card from his pocket. It has a very sexy woman on it.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BEAMISH
dialogues.text: See this... A feminist came into the Pennsylvania Avenue store this morning -- called me a 'sexist' and a 'pig' and tore the card up. I said 'Listen, we got naked men on cards, too, with their pee-pees hanging out... It's fair! We got men and we got women!' (MORE) (CONTINUED)
144 CONTINUED: (2) 144

dialogues.speaker: MR. BEAMISH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (CRYING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she spit in my face. WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, I'm sorry. I'm sorry I said I hated you...

dialogues.speaker: MR. BEAMISH
dialogues.text: That's okay. I'm sorry about Howie. You don't have to marry anybody you don't want to marry and if you want to move out, well, move out... But listen... He starts to get up with her help.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BEAMISH
dialogues.text: .. Don't judge your mother and me so hard... and the way we raised you and your sisters. There's no training to be a parent, you know. You're learning every day on the job. They start back toward the restaurant. WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no training to be me either, Dad. I'm learning on the job, too. He hugs her as they walk back into the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leslie enters carrying several empty cardboard boxes. She shakes off her many emotions and tries to efficiently gather her things. Beginning with record albums, she accidentally knocks an ashtray to the floor. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. As she picks up the broken pieces, the door opens from the bedroom. Alec appears, looking horrible, in his bathrobe. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I especially took off work because I thought you wouldn't be here. (CONTINUED)
145 CONTINUED: 145 ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sick. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong? ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just sickness... (noticing an album) .. Hey, you can't take The Pretenders' first album. That's mine. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bought it. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did not!!! (IN CONCESSION)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can have all the Billy Joels. Except for 'The Stranger.' LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm taking 'Thriller' and Mahler's Ninth. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin is so fond of Mahler. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've moved in with Jules. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How nice. Roomies again... (GRABBING ALBUMS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . No Springsteen is leaving this house. But you can have all the w Carly Simons. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got those for me on Valentine's Day. When there were still valentines around here. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ran out on this relationship. You take the consequences. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't run out on anything. You ran out. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucked Kevin! (CONTINUED)
145 CONTINUED: (2) 145 LESLIE Г‚ВЂВў

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucked manyl ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nameless, faceless manyl LESLIE (SARCASTICALLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I feel much better now. Alec angrily grabs another album from her. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not taking The Police so just forget it! LESLIE. I didn't 'fuck' Kevin. I was confused and angry... and I care for him deeply. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more albums! That's it... Get your clothes and give me the keys. Leslie reluctantly hands him the keys and moves toward the bedroom closet slowly. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe this is happening to us. Alec sits down angrily on the new sofa, clutching his albums. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasted love. I wish I could get it all back. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: LESLIE
dialogues.text: AFTERNOON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dealing with her emotions, she drives Jules' Jeep through the Georgetown streets. The back of the Jeep is filled with her clothes, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin is waiting on the doorstep with flowers, champagne, and a stack of newspapers. (CONTINUED)
147 CONTINUED: 147

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Leslie pulls up, he greets her by pressing a newspaper against the windshield. After a moment, she focuses on a small article entitled: "THE MEANING OF LIFE"; OBSER- VATIONS BY KEVIN DOLENZ. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did it!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leslie's stuff is still in boxes. Kevin fixes a fire as Leslie re-reads his article, sipping champagne. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, this is so exciting. Your first byline... KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure I'll be back doing obits tomorrow. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no. You're going to really attract some attention with this... (LAUGHING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did somebody actually say 'I believe in the golden rule, whoever's got the gold makes the rule'? KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sort of. Leslie, I couldn't write anything of any meaning until you. He kisses her warmly. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin. He aggressively gets on top of her, and feeling the excitement and the champagne kisses her madly. The front door opens and Jules appears breathless. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you two ever use a bed? Leaving the door wide open, she races through the apart- ment. Kevin continues to madly attack Leslie when Ron, carrying packages, arrives at his door across the hall. He and Kevin exchange a look as-Ron goes inside. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me show Jules your piece. (CONTINUED)
148 CONTINUED: 148

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs a paper and starts for the hall. She stops for a moment as she sees Jules, using her long pinky nail, deftly take a couple of pops of coke. Unaware that Leslie is watching, Jules starts back down the hall. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin has his first byline. Jules is so stoked she can't focus. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonderful. Brilliant... Ha ha... 'Tract Housing in Maryland'... LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's the other piece... Jules... JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got to fly. Forrester, the magnificent animal, is waiting. Did the hospital call? Is my stepmonster dead yet? LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules, I'd like to meet him. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have him wave up to you. She is out the door in a flash as Leslie moves toward - the window. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't she seem out of control to you? KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since the day I met her. They look out of the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down below Jules jumps into a small dark Mercedes, helped by a slightly nefarious-looking hunk. They wave to Leslie.

dialogues.speaker: INT'. APARTMENT 150
dialogues.text: KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that? (CONTINUED)
150 CONTINUED: 150 LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules' boss and lover... International banking seems to be getting sexier. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speaking of which... As she closes the window, Kevin attacks her again. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin, I've been thinking. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too, and I don't like to count my cornish hens before they hatch, but I do think I'll be getting a raise. And I was thinking we could get a place together. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it's fast. But I also know I love you. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you do love me. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean we love each other as friends. But... Kevin, you were sitting on all these incredible feelings... all tied up in that box with my pictures in desperate need of a love affair. And me... well, I needed to break the Alec habit... and it's only natural I would turn to you in my confusion. But this doesn't feel real. It feels manufactured. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me, isn't it? LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? You're a little ГўВЂВў miracle. (CONTINUED)
150 CONTINUED: (2) 150 KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But not a big miracle like Alec. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Alec was the big miracle for a long time... But I think I'd like to try life without any miracles for a while. Kevin realizes how serious Leslie is. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, having your first byline, and losing the love of your life in the same night has a certain 'The Gods must be laughing at me' feeling. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not the love of your life. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who says? LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're a girl, what do you know? Leslie embraces him with deep friendship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin and Kirbo are watching the and of ANNIE HALL. On screen, Woody says goodbye to Diane Keaton.

dialogues.speaker: WOODY CV.O.
dialogues.text: I realized what a terrific person she was and how much fun it was knowing her and I thought of that old joke, you know, this guy goes to a psychiatrist and says, 'Doc, uh, my brother's crazy. He thinks he's a chicken,' and the doctor says, 'Well, why don't you turn 14 him in?' And the guy says, 'I would, but I need the eggs.' Well, I guess that's pretty much how I feel about relationships. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
151 CONTINUED: 151

dialogues.speaker: WOODY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: R

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know they're totally irrational and crazy and absurd and... but .1 guess we keep going through it because, uh, most of us need the eggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin and Kirbo walk away from the theater advertising the "WOODY ALLEN FESTIVAL." KI RBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I need the eggs anymore. Dale Biberman gave me enough cholesterol for a lifetime. You were right all along... Love stinks. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had second thoughts. Intimacy is dangerous and shattering... but ultimately necessary. KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Kevin, I used to wait outside her house,. ring the bell and then when she'd come to the window I'd run away. Just to get a glimpse of her. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The night Leslie gave me the kiss- off, I fucked a black hooker three times. KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not Naomi, from our corner? KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naomi from our corner. KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you better go to the doctor and get some shots. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used a rubber. She put it on me with her mouth. Г‚ВЂВў

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop as they reach St. Elmo's. Looking inside, they see Alec at his usual table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alec is playing his old quarter game, but with Tommy Bancroft and his new political friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KI RBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always thought we'd be friends forever. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forever got a lot shorter suddenly. They move on, passing a sign on the door: "WAITER WARTED." Kevin points to it. KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, as soon as I get back in school, I'm going to work part- time for a law firm. Did you know there are as many people in law school as there are practicing lawyers? KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds familiar. KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd she put the rubber on with her mouth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A well-dressed female executive secretary looks disturbed as she enters a formidable office. She returns with a distinguished GENTLEMAN in a grey suit. He approaches Leslie who is waiting anxiously. GENTLEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, may I help you? LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see Forrester Davidson Jr. GENTLEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Forrester Davidson Jr. Leslie is shocked and even more confused. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there must be some mistake. I've come to see Julianna van Patten and they told me she doesn't work here anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Busy. Active. Alec is on a phone and talking to co- workers at the same time. He looks up to see Leslie, very shaken, waiting across the room. He is immediately angered, but eventually gets off the phone and joins her. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you forget one of your albums? LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to bother you here. It's Jules. After she left for work this morning, the finance company came and took away all her furniture, her Jeep, everything they could get their hands on... I couldn't reach her so I finally went over to her office. Alec -- she was fired three weeks ago! All this time, she's been pretending to go to work every day , and pretending to be still having this affair with her boss. And she's been doing a lot of coke .. Well, anyway, I confronted her at the apartment, and at first she denied everything, but then she went crazy -- and now she's locked herself in the apartment and she won't let me back in... I'm really worried about her. Alec hesitates angrily. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alec, please. I need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alec knocks on the door with Leslie. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules, open the door. Leslie puts her key in the door.

dialogues.speaker: DOOR
dialogues.text: Dead locks and a heavy bolt prevent it from opening.

dialogues.speaker: LESLIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: She's in there. (CONTINUED)     159 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: ALEC, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: ГўВЂВў Jules, come on. Just open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The main room is empty and dark, except for Jules, who sits on the floor dressed only in a thin T-shirt and bikini pants. Thin, tired, no makeup, this is a differ- ent Jules than we have seen before. Freezing winds shoot through the open window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules, remember my junior year when I went cold turkey on cigarettes? You sat up with me all night in the commons room feeding me emergency carrots...? No answer. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules, if you don't let us in, we're going to have to call the police. There is a beat and then Jules speaks from the depths of hell.

dialogues.speaker: JULES, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I'll throw myself out the window before they get through the door. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not my greatest ploy. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules, remember the time I flunked art history and I was trying to drink myself to death... Kevin and Kirbo come dashing up the stairs breathlessly. KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is she? LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just threatened to throw herself out the window. Kevin and Alec have a moment of awkwardness. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire escape!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alec, Kevin and Kirbo climb up the fire escape. They arrive at the second floor to find burglar proof grill- work locked in place, but the windows are still wide open

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the iron bars they see Jules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules, what are you doing? You'll freeze... He stops. KEVI N

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To death. Exactly! The three young men start tearing at the bars frantically

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leslie pounds on the door. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules, you're really scaring me now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alec, Kevin and Kirbo cannot budge the bars. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole country is.falling apart, but these five bars are made perfectly. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need something that cuts through metal. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or an experienced thief. KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll find Billy. Kirbo dashes down the fire escape. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was kidding. (CONTINUED)     166 CONTINUED: KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy's working at the big Chevron station on Michigan. He must have a hacksaw or something... Kirbo takes off on his bike as Alec looks at Kevin. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy is working in a gas station??? KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He needed the money. Suddenly, Alec and Kevin become aware that they are alone. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw your article. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, yesterday's editorial achievement is today's garbage wrapper, right...? Kevin tries to laugh charmingly. Alec tries to laugh along with him, but suddenly rage returns. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You little shit!!! He grabs Kevin. Kevin tries to fight back, but Alec is so overpowering he pushes Kevin up to the railing of the fire escape, and then pushes him over. Kevin hangs upside down as Alec holds him by his legs. Dozens of scraps of paper fall from his pocket. Leaning out the apartment hallway window, Leslie sees them. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alec, no!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leslie runs screaming through the hall and down the stairs, passing Ron Dellassandro who is just coming home from work. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin, still hanging upside down, tries to hang on to Alec. Papers continue to fly. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My notes! ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't need any more notes on the meaning of life. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (upside-down, STRAINING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm kinda betting on you not doing it, Al... think of your political career. Leslie runs into the alley underneath them. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alec, stop Iit! She frantically starts climbing the fire escape. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alec!!!

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO ALEC AND KEVIN
dialogues.text: ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After all I've done for you. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel I've done a lot for you, too, Al... so pull me up and we'll call it even. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you did for me was take the woman I was going to marry. The woman he was going to marry arrives frantically onto their landing. She struggles with Alec. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alec, stop it right now! Below them, Billy and Kirbo pull up in a Chevron tow truck. Billy, wearing Chevron coveralls, jumps out with an acetylene torch in hand, shouting. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks pretty ultimate up there...     168 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He helps Kirbo, who is struggling with a two-wheeler dolly holding a large tank of oxygen and acetylene.

dialogues.speaker: LESLIE, ALEC AND KEVIN
dialogues.text: KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think this is helping Jules? With Kevin's life still in his hands, he suddenly remembers Jules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking back inside, he sees her still in the same posi- tion, freezing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slowly pulls Kevin onto the fire escape. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right? Kirbo tries to get the dolly up the fire escape with Billy. KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Help. Kevin goes down the fire escape to help him, leaving Alec and Leslie alone. Leslie kneels by the window with her hands on the iron bars and speaks to Jules. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God. Jules, please, it's so cold. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very noble how you ran up here to save your lover. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not my lover. Jules, listen... ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have never lied to you once since the day I met you... you cocky shithead. (CONTINUED)
170 CONTINUED: 170

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alec knows it's the truth. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on, Jules. We all love you. She has been holding onto the bars with her bare-hands, but the bitter cold makes her wince as she removes her hands. Alec is overwhelmed with feelings as he takes her hands and holds them to his mouth, breathing warm breath onto them. Much emotion passes between them. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your breath, your breath is so sweet. ALEC. Leslie, I'm sorry. I'm so profoundly sorry. Kirbo and Kevin arrive. Billy races down the alley. KIRBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blowtorch, anyone? ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it to me. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not hand him a blowtorch! Kevin takes the torch and goes for the bars. SPARKS and fire fly. Suddenly there is a PHENOMENAL POUNDING from inside the apartment at Jules' front door. It stops everyone on the fire escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POUNDING jolts Jules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy pounds on the door as Ron watches nervously. BILLY (FRIENDLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules, it's Billy. Open the door. (NO REPLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Jules... Open up the goddamn door, or I'm coming right through it. No reply. Billy spots a large metal fire extinguisher at the end of the hall.
178 CONTINUED: 178 LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want some coffee, Ron? Ron enters tentatively and joins them as JULES and BILLY start SHOUTING and LAUGHING LOUDER. RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, until today I thought gay people were nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy sits on the floor playing his sax soulfully. WIDER ANGLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEALS it's Wendy's apartment. It is partially painted and a large ladder stands in the room. A small. wing chair has fabric swatches on it. Cartons, books, etc. Wendy sits on the floor watching Billy. WEND Y

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what happened? BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was it... We came out of the bedroom and had coffee with everybody. WEND Y

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saved her life. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not get dramatic. WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, when did you get so sane? BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I realized how insane I've been all this time tryin' to be like Alec and Leslie... and you and Kevin... I'm not part of this post-college Georgetown life; marriage and jobs. Felicia and Melody'll be better off without me. WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she get remarried already? BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three or four weeks... (MORE) (CONTINUED)
179 CONTINUED: 179 BILLY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinkin' of hanging around tryin'to be one of those in-the- neighborhood dads... but it would just confuse everybody... especially me. New York'll suit me fine. if somebody'll let me play sax. (INDICATING APARTMENT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is great. WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what's great. Last night I woke up in the middle of the night and made myself a peanut butter and jelly sandwich... and you know it was my kitchen, and my refrigerator and My apartment . and it was the best peanut butter and jelly sandwich I've ever had in my life. They chuckle together and then they become more serious. WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're goin', huh...? She picks up his sax and blows a few comic notes. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, are you still a virgin? WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is my sexual status so important to you? BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have I abused our relationship too much? Or could I be so bold... as to ask you for a going-away present...? Wendy is moved. CUT TO: 180 WENDY 18O

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lying on the floor of her bedroom. Only a candle lights the room. Billy's face comes INTO FRAME and they kiss, tenderly at first and then more passionately. Wendy looks beautiful and she and Billy are filled with a tenderness and love that can only exist from the years they have shared together. The SAX BUILDS as the wonder of the two young lovers builds. DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large bus pulls out as Leslie stands at a coffee vending machine. Alec approaches. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need someone to blow on your hands? She smiles, but shows him her gloves. As she searches for change in her pockets, Alec stops her and puts his own coins in the machine. He presses buttons as he talks. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know that I.always wanted to make you coffee? I tried once -- when you were in the shower -- but it didn't turn out right, so I threw it out and cleaned everything up so you wouldn't know. I don't like doing things I'm not good at -- like making coffee and saying I'm sorry... He looks at her sincerely as he hands her the plastic cup from the machine. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leslie, I'm sorry. They exchange a tender glance, and then Leslie takes a sip from the steaming cup. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alec, this is soup. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is soup. Alec's nervousness turns to embarrassment as they both start to laugh. Old feelings surge. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. They look at each other for a moment. LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need time. ALEC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ST. ELMO'S FIRE - Rev. 10/11/84 116A. 181 CONTINUED: (AL) 181

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirbo comes running over. KI RBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus is leaving. Alec and Leslie Join him and they quickly move to where Jules. Kevin and Wendy are saying goodbye to Billy who has his suitcase and sax. A bus waits. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Bye, baby. She hugs him expansively. Billy next kisses Leslie and shakes hands with the guys at the same time. Wendy waits until last and then they embrace emotionally. (CONTINUED)
181 CONTINUED: 181

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She whispers into his ear. WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ultimate. Billy smiles at her as she fights tears. BILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll keep in touch. WENDY (LAUGHING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you won't. He wants to say more to all of them, but the bus is wait- ing and he hops on it. The door closes and the bus backs out of the terminal. Billy stands near the driver and waves out at them. HIS FRIENDS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: watch him pull away. BUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it pulls backward, we can see Billy with his friend's reflections on the bus's windshield SUPERIMPOSED OVER his The bus's headlights flare INTO the CAMERA. The images of all of them mix with the white, hot GLARE SUPERIMPOSED OVER this, for a brief second we see IMAGES of them all from past, from school, from St. Elmo's, ,etc. The SCREEN GOES totally WHITE with incandescent brilliance as we --

dialogues.speaker: -EXT.. STREET
dialogues.text: `Alec, Leslie, Kevin, Krbo, Wendy and Jules walk together slowly. WIDER SHOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming upon St. F'1mo's, they stop. Looking,in the window... 183

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They see their old tables filled with younger students, led by Claton, the undergrad.
